Abstract: The field of language documentation has witnessed significant technological advancements in recent years, revolutionizing the way linguistic resources are created and mobilized. This paper explores the latest innovations in technology that have enhanced the efficiency and accessibility of language documentation efforts. From sophisticated audio and video recording equipment to advanced software for data analysis and archiving, these tools have enabled researchers to capture and preserve linguistic diversity with unprecedented accuracy. Furthermore, the integration of digital platforms and online repositories has facilitated the mobilization of linguistic resources, making them accessible to a global audience. This study highlights the impact of these technological advancements on the field of language documentation, emphasizing their role in promoting linguistic preservation and fostering cross-cultural understanding. The findings underscore the importance of continued investment in technology to support the vital work of language documentation and resource mobilization.
